name: scrape_website
description: Extract content from a single URL. Supports multiple formats and JavaScript rendering.

arguments.name: url_to_scrape
arguments.desc: The URL of the website you want to scrape

arguments.name: output_format
arguments.desc: Choose format: html, markdown, json, or text. Default: markdown

arguments.name: country
arguments.desc: Optional country code (e.g., US, GB, CA) for location-specific scraping

arguments.name: wait_before_scraping
arguments.desc: Wait time in milliseconds before scraping (0-10000)

arguments.name: parser
arguments.desc: Optional parser ID for specialized extraction (e.g., @olostep/amazon-product)

name: search_web
description: Search the web for a given query and return structured results (non-AI, parser-based)

arguments.name: query
arguments.desc: Search query

arguments.name: country
arguments.desc: Optional country code for localized results (e.g., US, GB)

name: answers
description: Search the web and return AI-powered answers in the JSON structure you want, with sources and citations

arguments.name: task
arguments.desc: Question or task to answer using web data

arguments.name: json
arguments.desc: Optional JSON schema/object or description of desired output shape

name: batch_scrape_urls
description: Scrape up to 10k URLs at the same time. Perfect for large-scale data extraction

arguments.name: urls_to_scrape
arguments.desc: JSON array of objects with url and optional custom_id

arguments.name: output_format
arguments.desc: Choose format for all URLs. Default: markdown

arguments.name: country
arguments.desc: Optional country code for location-specific scraping

arguments.name: wait_before_scraping
arguments.desc: Wait time in milliseconds before scraping each URL

arguments.name: parser
arguments.desc: Optional parser ID for specialized extraction

name: create_crawl
description: Autonomously discover and scrape entire websites by following links from a start URL

arguments.name: start_url
arguments.desc: Starting URL for the crawl

arguments.name: max_pages
arguments.desc: Maximum number of pages to crawl

arguments.name: follow_links
arguments.desc: Whether to follow links found on pages

arguments.name: output_format
arguments.desc: Format for scraped content. Default: markdown

arguments.name: country
arguments.desc: Optional country code for location-specific crawling

arguments.name: parser
arguments.desc: Optional parser ID for specialized content extraction

name: create_map
description: Get all URLs on a website. Extract URLs for discovery and site analysis

arguments.name: website_url
arguments.desc: Website URL to extract links from

arguments.name: search_query
arguments.desc: Optional search query to filter URLs

arguments.name: top_n
arguments.desc: Optional limit for number of URLs returned

arguments.name: include_url_patterns
arguments.desc: Optional glob patterns to include (e.g., /blog/**)

arguments.name: exclude_url_patterns
arguments.desc: Optional glob patterns to exclude (e.g., /admin/**)

name: get_webpage_content
description: Retrieve content of a webpage in markdown format

arguments.name: url_to_scrape
arguments.desc: The URL of the webpage to scrape

arguments.name: wait_before_scraping
arguments.desc: Time to wait in milliseconds before starting the scrape

arguments.name: country
arguments.desc: Residential country to load the request from (e.g., US, CA, GB)

name: get_website_urls
description: Search and retrieve relevant URLs from a website

arguments.name: url
arguments.desc: The URL of the website to map

arguments.name: search_query
arguments.desc: The search query to sort URLs by

name: google_search
description: Retrieve structured data from Google search results

arguments.name: query
arguments.desc: The search query to perform

arguments.name: country
arguments.desc: Country code for localized results (e.g., US, GB)
